(50) 11012TH MAY, 1950CABINETPROPOSED FRANCO-GERMAN COAL AND STEEL AUTHORITYNote by the Prime MlnisterI have arranged that a committee of senior officials should be set up to collect all available information about the proposed Franco-German Coal andSteel Authority and to advise Ministers on the possible effects of the scheme on this country.The Permanent Secretary, Treasury, will act as chairman of the committee. Its other members will includethe Chief Planning Officer and the Permanent Secretariesor other senior officers of the Foreign Office, Board ofTrade and Ministries of Defence, Fuel and Power and supply.The Committee, in reporting on the proposals,will distinguish between a purely European scheme and ascheme involving United Kingdom participation and willgive an appreciation of the effect of the proposals onthe United Kingdom economy (assuming that present policies of a planned economy, full employment, etc. , arecontinued) and on the general economy of the commonwealth and sterling area. They will also include an appreciation of the defence aspects of the matter.COPY NO.C.R.A.10, Downing Street, S.W.1.,12TH MAY, 1950./
